intro: Myrceugenia luma, commonly known as the Luma or the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species native to the southern regions of South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in humid, subtropical climates. The plant features glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy fruits. It is well adapted to acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous areas. Myrceugenia luma plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
